titles.title: To suspend the visa waiver program until certain entry-exit control requirements are met, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.

bill.summary: 5/17/2006--Introduced. Suspends the nonimmigrant visitor visa waiver program until the Secretary of Homeland Security certifies to Congress that: (1) the automated entry-exit control system is fully implemented and functional; (2) all U.S. ports of entry have functional biometric machine readers; and (3) all nonimmigrants, including Border Crossing Card holders, are processed through the automated entry-exit control system. Amends the Immigration and Nationality Act to repeal the machine readable passport (including discretionary waiver) provisions of such program.
